item.title: a. Let Him Go, Olivia
item.description: There I was. Upside down inside the swimming pool. Drowned. My parents were screaming. It must have been the summer of ‘63. It was a gloomy day. Every Sunday we went to my grandparents’ house. My cousins and I were playing alongside the pool. I must have slipped. At three years old, I did not know how to swim. My mother was giving me CPR. More than twenty or twenty-five minutes had gone by.

item.title: a. Reading to Learn the Art of Expression
item.description: 课文 When you read a short story, you may read it merely for pleasure. When you read a biographical sketch, you may read it merely for information. But as you are a learner of English, I think you should often read to learn the art of expression. And for this purpose you may read either a short story or a biographical sketch, either an essay or a news item, indeed, anything that is written in good current English.

item.title: z. 形容词 `then` 用法详解
item.description: 核心概念 这里的 then 不是副词“然后”，而是形容词“当时的”。 原句分析 原短语： then recently discovered CPR 字面意思： “在当时那个时间点，新近被发现的心肺复苏术” 结构： then（形容词） + recently discovered（复合形容词） + CPR（名词） 语法功能 时间锚定作用 then 将“新发现”的时间锁定在故事发生的过去时刻，而不是作者写作的现在时刻。 双重时间限定 recently discovered：相对于某个时间点“最近” then：明确指出这个时间点是故事中的1963年 拆解理解 Without then: 新近发现的CPR（可能指现在的新发现） With then: 在当时（1963年） 算是新近发现的CPR 同义转换 …utilizing CPR, which was, at that time, a recently discovered technique.
